content:
I came across this 2020 video where @Scott Morrison shows how to prove infinitude of primes.
https://youtu.be/ArGLTAjak3g?t=517
In the video he uses back? tactic which provides the proof immediately by 'backwards reasoning' (the link jumps right to the part).
I noticed that the back tactic cannot be used with the lean version I have now.

  • What happened to back tactic?
  • Which tactics can be used to do a similar thing? (That is, automatically assemble proof terms from what we know in previous theorems and mathlib)
This was never in mathlib. It was an experiment by Scott. This kind of things will probably exist in Lean 4. You should have a look at aesop
